  • Element
org.easetech.easytest.annotation

Annotation Type DataLoader


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value={METHOD,TYPE})
@Inherited
public @interface DataLoader
    A method or class level annotation providing users with the ability to specify a data Loader strategy for their test class. EasyTest supports CSV, EXCEL and XML based data loading. But it may not be sufficient in all the cases. Also EasyTest's Data Loading Strategy may not suit every user. In such a case, a user can write his own Custom Loader and pass it to the Data Loader annotation to supply its own custom Loader.
    For eg. this is how you can use it :
    @Test @DataLoader(loader=MyCustomDataLoader.class)
    public void testGetItems(........
    OR

    @Test @DataLoader(filePaths={testData.json} , loader=MyCustomDataLoader.class)
    public void testGetItems(........
    OR
    @Test @DataLoader(filePaths={testData.csv})
    public void testGetItems(........
    OR
    @Test @DataLoader(filePaths={testDataExcel.xls})
    public void testGetItems(........
    Note that the custom Loader must implement the Loader interface and should have a no arg constructor.
    The data loader annotation also supports the functionality for the user to specify whether the data should be written back to the test file or not using the attribute writeData(). Its default value is Boolean.TRUE.
    A user can also specify whether the test data should be overrideen or should be appended in case the test data is present in more than one file. The user can do that using the appendData() attribute. If the value is True, then the data from different files is preserved and the test is run for each row of test data specified in each test data file. if the value is False(also the default value), then the test data in file 1 is overridden with test data in file 2.
    Author:
    Anuj Kumar

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean appendData
      Boolean identifying whether data specified in two different files for the same method should be appended or replaced.
      String[] filePaths
      The list of file paths representing the input test data for the given test method.
      Class<? extends Loader> loader
      The custom Loader class that will be used by EasyTest to load the test data.
      LoaderType loaderType
      The type of file that contains the data.
      boolean writeData
      Boolean identifying whether the data should be written back to the file or not.

    • Element Detail

      • filePaths

        public abstract String[] filePaths
        The list of file paths representing the input test data for the given test method.
        Default:
        {}

      • loaderType

        public abstract LoaderType loaderType
        The type of file that contains the data. Defaults to "none". This attribute has become optional mostly because EasyTest can figure out the type of loader, based on the extension of the test-data file. It is mostly used to give hint to EasyTest. It is also used to specify that the loader is Custom and not a standard loader.
        Default:
        org.easetech.easytest.loader.LoaderType.NONE

      • loader

        public abstract Class<? extends Loader> loader
        The custom Loader class that will be used by EasyTest to load the test data. In case of standard DataLoaders for Excel, CSV and XML, you dont have to provide any Loader. This attribute is used only when the LoaderType is Custom.
        Default:
        org.easetech.easytest.loader.EmptyLoader.class

      • writeData

        public abstract boolean writeData
        Boolean identifying whether the data should be written back to the file or not. Default behavior is that the data will be written back to the file. Data from a test method is written back to the file only when the test method returns something. In case the test method returns void, then even though this attribute is set to true, nothing will be written back to the file.
        Default:
        true

      • appendData

        public abstract boolean appendData
        Boolean identifying whether data specified in two different files for the same method should be appended or replaced. Default behavior is to replace the data present in one file from the other.
        Returns:
        whether data should be appended or not
        Default:
        false
